content.raw:
After adding some debug statements, I think the problem on Jenkins is not about timing, but about the positions we're sending. I added some print statements and locally we can see the pill is moved until it is dragged over another one:

~~~
[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePill.cc:483] Pressed variable2
[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePillContainer_TEST.cc:126] Created move 1

[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePill.cc:491] Moving over variable2

[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePill.cc:491] Moving over variable2

[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePill.cc:491] Moving over variable2

[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePill.cc:513] /Moving over variable2
[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePillContainer_TEST.cc:149] Triggered move 12
[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePill.cc:328] Drag entered variable3
[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePill.cc:350] /Drag entered variable3
[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePillContainer_TEST.cc:149] Triggered move 13
[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePillContainer_TEST.cc:149] Triggered move 14

[GUI] [Dbg] [VariablePill.cc:357] Dropped on variable3

~~~
